workflows.name: Ship a SaaS MVP
workflows.description: End-to-end workflow to scope, build, test, and ship a SaaS MVP quickly.

steps.title: Plan the scope
steps.goal: Convert the idea into a clear implementation plan and milestones.
steps.notes: Define problem, user persona, MVP boundaries, and acceptance criteria before coding.

steps.title: Build backend and API
steps.goal: Implement the core data model, API contracts, and auth baseline.
steps.notes: Prefer small vertical slices; keep API contracts explicit and testable.

steps.title: Build frontend
steps.goal: Deliver the primary user flows with production-grade UX patterns.
steps.notes: Prioritize onboarding, empty states, and one complete happy-path flow.

steps.title: Test and validate
steps.goal: Catch regressions and ensure key flows work before release.
steps.notes: Use go-playwright when the product stack or QA tooling is Go-based.

steps.title: Ship safely
steps.goal: Release with basic observability and rollback readiness.
steps.notes: Define release checklist, minimum telemetry, and rollback triggers.

workflows.name: Security Audit for a Web App
workflows.description: Structured workflow for baseline AppSec review and risk triage.

steps.title: Define scope and threat model
steps.goal: Identify critical assets, trust boundaries, and threat scenarios.
steps.notes: Document in-scope targets, assumptions, and out-of-scope constraints.

steps.title: Review authentication and authorization
steps.goal: Find broken auth patterns and access-control weaknesses.
steps.notes: Prioritize account takeover and privilege escalation paths.

steps.title: Assess API and input security
steps.goal: Detect high-impact API and injection risks.
steps.notes: Map findings to severity and exploitability, not only CVSS.

steps.title: Harden and verify
steps.goal: Translate findings into concrete remediations and retest.
steps.notes: Track remediation owners and target dates; verify each fix with evidence.

workflows.name: Build an AI Agent System
workflows.description: Workflow to design, implement, and evaluate a production-ready AI agent.

steps.title: Define use case and reliability targets
steps.goal: Choose a narrow use case and measurable quality goals.
steps.notes: Set latency, quality, and failure-rate thresholds before implementation.

steps.title: Design architecture and retrieval
steps.goal: Design tools, memory, and retrieval strategy for the agent.
steps.notes: Keep retrieval quality measurable and version prompt/tool contracts.

steps.title: Implement orchestration
steps.goal: Implement the orchestration loop and production safeguards.
steps.notes: Start with constrained tool permissions and explicit fallback behavior.

steps.title: Evaluate and iterate
steps.goal: Run benchmark scenarios and improve weak areas systematically.
steps.notes: Use test datasets and failure buckets to guide each iteration cycle.

workflows.name: QA and Browser Automation
workflows.description: Workflow for robust E2E and browser-driven validation across stacks.

steps.title: Prepare test strategy
steps.goal: Define critical user journeys, environments, and test data.
steps.notes: Focus on business-critical flows and keep setup deterministic.

steps.title: Implement browser tests
steps.goal: Automate key flows with resilient locators and stable waits.
steps.notes: Use go-playwright for Go-native automation projects and Playwright for JS/TS stacks.

steps.title: Triage failures and harden
steps.goal: Stabilize flaky tests and establish repeatable CI execution.
steps.notes: Classify failures by root cause: selector drift, timing, environment, data.

workflows.name: Design a DDD Core Domain
workflows.description: Workflow to model complex domains and implement tactical and evented patterns with explicit boundaries.

steps.title: Assess DDD fit and scope
steps.goal: Decide if full DDD is justified and define the modeling scope.
steps.notes: Document why DDD is needed, where to keep it lightweight, and what success looks like.

steps.title: Create strategic model
steps.goal: Define subdomains, bounded contexts, and ubiquitous language.
steps.notes: Classify subdomains and assign ownership before making implementation decisions.

steps.title: Map context relationships
steps.goal: Define context integration patterns, ownership, and translation boundaries.
steps.notes: Prefer explicit contracts and anti-corruption layers where domain models diverge.

steps.title: Implement tactical model
steps.goal: Encode invariants with aggregates, value objects, repositories, and domain events.
steps.notes: Start from invariants and transaction boundaries, not from tables or endpoints.

steps.title: Adopt evented patterns selectively
steps.goal: Apply CQRS, event store, projections, and sagas only where required.
steps.notes: Use evented patterns where consistency and scale tradeoffs are explicit and accepted.
